item.title: I've always wanted to know this
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Noob.Coder, post:10, topic:368589”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=464738.msg3398400#msg3398400 date=1289685623]
I suggest using an IDE over all of them, you can use NetBeans or Eclipse either is fine, or if you find another IDE that you like more you can use that.
[/quote]
What does an IDE do?[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Eclipse (software)

Eclipse is an integrated development environment (IDE) used in computer programming, and is the most widely used Java IDE. It contains a base workspace and an extensible plug-in system for customizing the environment. Eclipse is written mostly in Java and its primary use is for developing Java applications, but it may also be used to develop applications in other programming languages via plug-ins, including Ada, ABAP, C, C++, C#, COBOL, D, Fortran, Haskell, JavaScript, Julia, Lasso, Lua, N The i...

Read full topic

item.title: I've always wanted to know this
item.dc:creator: @Noob.Coder Noob.Coder
item.description:
@Noob.Coder wrote:

[quote=“EmulousGuru, post:7, topic:368589”]It honestly doesn’t matter whether you have:

public void test(){sendMessage("hi");}

OR

public void test(){
sendMessage("hi");
}

OR

public void test(){
    sendMessage("hi");
}

ETC.

They all have the same function.

Though, it’s best to use conventions, as it helps organize code, and allows you to edit it easier.[/quote]

To be honest, I find not having any spaces easier. And you know, I am the person you’re talking to about portforwarding my $130 router. LOL what a coincidence

Read full topic
item.source: I've always wanted to know this

item.title: I've always wanted to know this
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

It honestly doesn’t matter whether you have:

public void test(){sendMessage("hi");}

OR

public void test(){
sendMessage("hi");
}

OR

public void test(){
    sendMessage("hi");
}

ETC.

They all have the same function.

Though, it’s best to use conventions, as it helps organize code, and allows you to edit it easier.

Read full topic

item.title: I've always wanted to know this
item.dc:creator: @Noob.Coder Noob.Coder
item.description:
@Noob.Coder wrote:

Alright, well usually when I do some “coding” if you want to call it that, I use the search bar copy and paste. IK IK IK it’s “leeching” my bad. I would start actually coding if I knew this one simple thing…

Why are there like tab-ins in codes? Such as:

if (p.username.equals("NAME")) { p.rights = 2; }

Confuses me so much… Why can’t it be just simply written as :

if (p.username.equals("NAME")) { p.rights = 2; }

The reason I am asking this is because when I try to make my own code, I do not know how many spaces to put in between and where to put them.

Read full topic
item.source: I've always wanted to know this
